name: K100 Citizens Waterway | A 2023 Documentary
description:
Join us for the screening of K100 Citizens’ Waterway, a 2023 documentary that chronicles the transformation of a neglected stormwater drain in Bengaluru into a functional, flood-resilient public space. The film captures the people, processes, and challenges behind this pioneering urban infrastructure project. Conceived and steered by Mod Foundation, the K100 project is an example of how data, design, and inter-agency collaboration can redefine public infrastructure and urban life.

Presented at Science Gallery Bengaluru, the screening will be followed by a discussion with the Mod Foundation team and the filmmakers. Together, they will unpack the project's approach to informed decision-making, citizen participation, and data-driven governance, offering insights into what it takes to build resilient, inclusive cities in India today.

name: Specimens and Stories: A Visit to Natural History Collections

location.name: National Centre for Biological Sciences
location.address: National Centre for Biological Sciences, Bangalore

description:
How are specimens collected, preserved, and studied?

Join us at the Natural History Collections at NCBS and discover the fascinating world of specimens. This visit will be an opportunity to see how scientists collect, preserve, and study specimens that help us understand the story of our planet’s biodiversity. From pressed plants and drawers full of insects to preserved bird specimens, every item offers clues about biodiversity, evolution, and environmental change. Participants will also learn how these collections support research, education, and conservation, and hear the stories behind them.
